video.title: How to Make a Custom Website from Scratch using WordPress (Theme Development) - 2019 Tutorial
video.description:
Learn to create a completely responsive website from scratch using WordPress, HTML, CSS, JavaScpript, and PHP. Also, learn to create a custom WordPress theme.

After watching this course you will have a solid understanding of how WordPress works and how to create your own custom theme in WordPress. 

🔗 Design Source Code: https://github.com/Godsont/Responsive-Website-Design

🔗 Theme Source Code: https://gtcoding.net/product/gtcoding-wp-custom-theme/

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro and Demo
⌨️ (0:00:55) Research & Planning
⌨️ (0:10:52) UI Design - The Front Page
⌨️ (0:27:47) UI Design - CSS
⌨️ (0:59:07) UI Design - JavaScript
⌨️ (1:05:11) UI Design - More Pages
⌨️ (1:20:43) PHP Basics
⌨️ (1:58:31) Installing WordPress locally
⌨️ (2:03:05) WordPress - style.css file
⌨️ (2:11:47) WordPress - linking CSS and JS
⌨️ (2:23:17) WordPress - Custom Post Type
⌨️ (2:33:31) WordPress - Template Hierarchy
⌨️ (2:43:29) WordPress - while loop
⌨️ (2:54:52) WordPress - the Front Page
⌨️ (3:11:44) WordPress - Blogs Index Page
⌨️ (3:26:42) WordPress - Single Post Page & Comments
⌨️ (3:52:59) WordPress - Sidebar & Search
⌨️ (4:14:35) WordPress - Contact Form
⌨️ (4:20:17) WordPress - Custom 404 Page
⌨️ (4:24:19) Finishing Up

Other Links:
🔗 Template Hierarchy: https://developer.wordpress.org/files/2014/10/wp-hierarchy.png
🔗 Link for the time formats in the_time() function: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/the_time
🔗 Comment Form: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/comment_form

replies.author: Elena Novinskiy
replies.text:
​@johan barrios ok, I was just curious and decided to start over with creating a custom post type. As a matter of fact I created 2, book and product, cause I wanted to try creating multiple custom post types. Here is my functions code.


function book_post_type(){
  $labels = array (
    'name'                => _x( 'Books', 'Post Type General Name', 'text_domain' ),
    'singular_name'       => _x( 'Book', 'Post Type Singular Name', 'text_domain' ),
    'menu_name'           => __( 'Books', 'text_domain' ),
    'parent_item_colon'   => __( 'Parent Item:', 'text_domain' ),
    'all_items'           => __( 'All Books', 'text_domain' ),
    'view_item'           => __( 'View Book', 'text_domain' ),
    'add_new_item'        => __( 'Add New Book', 'text_domain' ),
    'add_new'             => __( 'Add New', 'text_domain' ),
    'edit_item'           => __( 'Edit Book', 'text_domain' ),
    'update_item'         => __( 'Update Book', 'text_domain' ),
    'search_items'        => __( 'Search Book', 'text_domain' ),
    'not_found'           => __( 'Not found', 'text_domain' ),
    'not_found_in_trash'  => __( 'Not found in Trash', 'text_domain' ),
  );
  $args = array(
    'label'               => __( 'book', 'text_domain' ),
    'description'         => __( 'Post Type Description', 'text_domain' ),
    'labels'              => $labels,
    'show_in_rest'        => true,//add Gutenberg Editor Support
    'supports'            => array('title', 'thumbnail', 'editor', 'excerpt', 'comments'),
    'taxonomies'          => array( 'category', 'post_tag' ),
    'hierarchical'        => false,
    'public'              => true,
    'show_ui'             => true,
    'show_in_menu'        => true,
    'show_in_nav_menus'   => true,
    'show_in_admin_bar'   => true,
    'menu_position'       => 5,
    'menu_icon'           => 'dashicons-clipboard',
    'can_export'          => true,
    'has_archive'         => true,
    'exclude_from_search' => false,
    'publicly_queryable'  => true,
  );
  register_post_type( 'book', $args );
}
// Hook into the 'init' action
add_action( 'init', 'book_post_type' );


function product_post_type(){
  $labels = array (
    'name'                => _x( 'Products', 'Post Type General Name', 'text_domain' ),
    'singular_name'       => _x( 'Product', 'Post Type Singular Name', 'text_domain' ),
    'menu_name'           => __( 'Products', 'text_domain' ),
    'parent_item_colon'   => __( 'Parent Item:', 'text_domain' ),
    'all_items'           => __( 'All Products', 'text_domain' ),
    'view_item'           => __( 'View Products', 'text_domain' ),
    'add_new_item'        => __( 'Add New Product', 'text_domain' ),
    'add_new'             => __( 'Add New', 'text_domain' ),
    'edit_item'           => __( 'Edit Product', 'text_domain' ),
    'update_item'         => __( 'Update Product', 'text_domain' ),
    'search_items'        => __( 'Search Product', 'text_domain' ),
    'not_found'           => __( 'Not found', 'text_domain' ),
    'not_found_in_trash'  => __( 'Not found in Trash', 'text_domain' ),
  );
  $args = array(
    'label'               => __( 'product', 'text_domain' ),
    'description'         => __( 'Post Type Description', 'text_domain' ),
    'labels'              => $labels,
    'show_in_rest'        => true,//add Gutenberg Editor Support
    'supports'            => array('title', 'thumbnail', 'editor', 'excerpt', 'comments'),
    'taxonomies'          => array( 'category', 'post_tag' ),
    'hierarchical'        => false,
    'public'              => true,
    'show_ui'             => true,
    'show_in_menu'        => true,
    'show_in_nav_menus'   => true,
    'show_in_admin_bar'   => true,
    'menu_position'       => 9,
    'menu_icon'           => 'dashicons-clipboard',
    'can_export'          => true,
    'has_archive'         => true,
    'exclude_from_search' => false,
    'publicly_queryable'  => true,
  );
  register_post_type( 'product', $args );
}
// Hook into the 'init' action
add_action( 'init', 'product_post_type' );


After this I went ahead and created several book posts and several product posts. When I went to check is I get respective post pages and post feeds I also got Page Not Found. So I went to Setting > Permalinks. I had it set to "Post name" from the very beginning. So I did not change anything there. I just clicked Save Changes. And then everything started working as it should.


You are welcome to use this code. I just find this way it is a bit more structured and there is less arrays within arrays. Also keep in mind that the function name cannot exceed 20 characters including underscores. So your function ep_custom_post_type() is 19 characters. I would name it simply ep_post_type() or something to make it shorter.

replies.author: Christopher Roelle
replies.text:
On any element that you want to access the hover pseudo code. On li:hover, if the user hovers over an li tag, that list item contained within the tag will take on the css of the hover code. 

So with a a{ color: white; } a:hover{ color: blue; }, any links on the page that the user hovers over will turn blue, and when they stop hovering over the link it will return to white
